intro: Pavetta subcana var. subcana, commonly known as the white pavetta, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. The plant has elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is native to parts of Africa and Southeast Asia. Its botanical features make it a notable species in tropical and subtropical regions.
